CatDescriptText: Mr. Thomas Demas, unemployed, Hill District and Mr. Harvey Ambassador McGeorge, job hunter, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 7, 1962, pg. 12 with question: "How do you think the Pirates will do in 1962?" Mr. Thomas Demas' answer reads: "I think they will make it to the top.  At least I hope so."  Mr. Harvey Ambassador McGeorge's answer reads: "Not so good.  They need a lot of things.  Clemente's the best thing on teh team.  They don't have too much else."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Thomas Demas wearing plaid shirt and zippered jacket, standing in front of light colored building with chiseled block trim; Portrait of Harvey Ambassador McGeorge wearing dark hat and leather jacket, standing in front of light colored building with chiseled block trim
